kickstart.description: Mail hub for the cluster. This node serves as the post-office for the whole cluster.
kickstart.changelog:
$Log: mail-server.xml,v $ Revision 1.3 2010/09/24 00:40:20 anoop Added admin to recipients since this is the default Info_ClusterContact value
Revision 1.2 2009/01/23 21:50:23 bruno var tags converted to entities
Revision 1.1 2007/12/10 21:28:33 bruno the base roll now contains several elements from the HPC roll, thus making the HPC roll optional.
this also includes changes to help build and configure VMs for V.
Revision 1.9 2005/02/16 00:40:04 mjk graph cleanup
Revision 1.8 2004/09/11 04:25:09 fds Frontend and computes have same 'from' email address
Revision 1.7 2004/04/26 21:48:22 fds Being paranoid. Catch all mail to root@public even though this should not occur. Such mail will stay on the root account of the frontend.
Revision 1.6 2004/04/23 08:17:09 fds Simpler. Also allows sending to local recipients: mail from compute to fds@local will now work too.
Revision 1.5 2004/04/21 07:34:37 fds Keep mail to root@foo.com on the frontend. This retains mail bounce alerts and such locally like we want it.
Revision 1.4 2004/04/21 06:50:56 fds This was painful. If the frontend has a public domain foo.org I do not want it to "accept" all mail for *@foo.org, since there will most likely be a better mail server out there. This change tells the frontend postfix server to accept mail only for *@local, and to send out anything else. But sending from @local will not get you very far, so we always rewrite our sending envelope address to our public domain.
Revision 1.3 2004/03/08 23:14:19 fds Here is Postfix.
Revision 1.2 2004/03/05 01:18:17 fds Postfix tweaks.
Revision 1.1 2004/03/04 19:33:32 fds Moving from sendmail to Postfix.

post.file: # # Rocks Postfix configuration for mail server. # mydomain = &Kickstart_PrivateDNSDomain; mydestination = $mydomain, $myhostname, localhost.$mydomain mynetworks = &Kickstart_PrivateNetwork;/&Kickstart_PrivateNetmaskCIDR;, 127.0.0.0/8 inet_interfaces = all append_dot_mydomain = no sender_canonical_maps = hash:/etc/postfix/sender-canonical recipient_canonical_maps = hash:/etc/postfix/recipient-canonical
# Add "admin" to the list of recipients admin: root

kickstart.configure: if [ "&Kickstart_PrivateDNSDomain_old;" ]; then sed -i 's/&Kickstart_PrivateDNSDomain_old;/&Kickstart_PrivateDNSDomain;/g' \ /etc/postfix/main.cf fi if [ "&Kickstart_PrivateNetwork_old;" ]; then old_networks='&Kickstart_PrivateNetwork_old;' if [ "&Kickstart_PrivateNetmaskCIDR_old;" ]; then old_networks="$old_networks\/&Kickstart_PrivateNetmaskCIDR_old;" else old_networks="$old_networks\/&Kickstart_PrivateNetmaskCIDR;" fi sed -i "s/$old_networks/&Kickstart_PrivateNetwork;\/&Kickstart_PrivateNetmaskCIDR;/g" \ /etc/postfix/main.cf fi
